course_title: Topics in Applied and Computational Mathematics

learning_outcomes.description: Explain how mathematical modelling and simulation can be applied to understanding phenomena in the natural sciences
Model problems with differential equations (ordinary, partial, stochastic) and obtain and interpret accurate numerical solutions to these problems
For a given phenomenon, explain how mathematical models on different levels of detail are related to each other through asymptotic expansion
Discuss and interpret the concept of emergent phenomena in physics and biology
Conceptualise and solve a scientific problem using the appropriate numerical techniques
Implement advanced numerical methods of solving partial differential equations, including finite element method, boundary element method
Evaluate and implement advanced agent/particle-based simulation techniques
Demonstrate written communication skills appropriate for scientific reports

assessments.weighting: <dd>60% 15% each for assignments 1 and 2; 10% each for assignments 3,4 and 5  </dd>
assessments.task_description: You will need to solve tutorial problems and/or to implement numerical codes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your assignment electronically on Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Final take home assignment covering part I
assessments.task_description: You will need to solve an extended project like problem and to implement numerical codes.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Please submit your assignment electronically on Blackboard
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description: You will need to answer questions covering the theoretical component of the second half of the course.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

Presentation of mathematical theory

either 2 or 3 theoretical lectures per week - depending on nature of content.
